intro: Thlaspi obtusatum, commonly known as bluntleaf cabbageworm, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, green, oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are white or pale purple, arranged in racemes, and are characterized by four petals. Thlaspi obtusatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats including roadsides and waste areas.
